sensiverse 0.0.1
  • Reference

Estimate a specification universe (OLS) for a focus variable

Source: R/all.R
estimate_model_space.Rd

Runs OLS regressions across a user-defined grid (dependent variables, control sets, fixed effects, SE type, and sample split) and collects results only for focus_var.

estimate_model_space(df, focus_var, specs, space_n = 150000)

Arguments

df

Data frame containing DEP*, CONT*, FEgroup, FEtime, and SAMPLE* columns.

focus_var

Character. IV of interest (e.g., "CONTa").

specs

Named list with components:

dep

Character vector of dependent variables present in df.

cont

Character vector of candidate controls (e.g., CONT*).

fes

Subset of c("none","time","group","time+group").

set

Subset of c("simple","robust","clustered").

sample

Character vector of sample-split dummies (cols in df).

space_n

Optional integer. If the full grid is larger, a random sample of at most space_n specifications is estimated (for speed).

Value

A tibble with coefficient, SE, p-value, significance class, and full specification metadata for focus_var.

See also

Other model-space: calculate_sign_shares(), filter_model_space(), plot_sign_share()
